detaileddescription.para: Generate secure random bytes using the rand_bytes function from OpenSSL

parameterdescription.para: the number of bytes to generate

simplesect.para: a buffer containing 'len' secure random bytes or NULL if random byte generation fails

detaileddescription.para: Generate a secure random cipher key for a particular cipher Currently supports AES256-GCM and AES256-CTR cipher modes

parameterdescription.para: the cipher to generate a random key for

simplesect.para: a cipher key containing key material generated by 'openssl_crypto_random' or NULL if random byte generation fails

detaileddescription.para: Encrypt a buffer using AES256 Currently supports AES256-GCM and AES256-CTR cipher modes
NOTE: IV is randomly chosen using 'openssl_crypto_random' if one is not provided

parameterdescription.para: the content to encrypt using 'key'
the cipher key to use to encrypt 'plaintext'
an initialization vector to use with the cipher mode, or NULL if one should be chosen at random

simplesect.para: a cipher result containing encrypted bytes, or NULL if the cipher mode fails or is not supported

detaileddescription.para: Decrypt a cipher_result using AES256 Currently supports AES256-GCM and AES256-CTR cipher modes

parameterdescription.para: a cipher result generated from 'openssl_aes256_encrypt'
the key to use to attempt to decrypt 'cipher_result'
if true, only authenticated ciphers may be used for decryption

simplesect.para: a buffer containing decrypted bytes. If the AES mode is authenticated, NULL will be returned if key is incorrect.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate a SHA2 hash of a buffer using an optional salt value Supported modes of SHA2 are SHA256, SHA384 and SHA512

parameterdescription.para: the buffer to hash
a salt value to concatenate to buffer before taking the hash. The input to the SHA2 function will be SHA2(buffer || salt) Passing NULL will allow for no salt to be used
the mode of SHA2 to use for hashing

simplesect.para: a buffer containing the derived hash or NULL if the hashing operation fails

detaileddescription.para: Generate a random Elliptical Curve keypair Supported curve is currently limited to NIST P521

parameterdescription.para: the curve parameters to use for random key pair generation

simplesect.para: a random Elliptical Curve key pair or NULL if the random generation fails

detaileddescription.para: Import an Elliptical Curve key from a buffer

parameterdescription.para: the buffer representing Elliptical Curve key material
false if the buffer represents a public key

simplesect.para: an Elliptical Curve key pair parsed from buffer or NULL if buffer does not contain a valid key, or is_private is incorrectly set

detaileddescription.para: Sign data using an Elliptical Curve key Data is hashed before signing. This function will calculate ECDSA(SHA2(data_to_sign))

parameterdescription.para: private signing key to use for the ECDSA algorithm
the data to hash with 'digest_mode', and then sign with 'ec_signing_key'
the digest mode to use for SHA2

simplesect.para: an ecdsa result containing the output of ECDSA(SHA2(data_to_sign)) or NULL if the 'ec_signing_key' is not a private key

parameterdescription.para: a signature produced with 'openssl_ec_sign'
the public signing key to use for verification
the original data that should have been signed with 'ec_public_key'. It will be hashed inside this function as part of the verification process

simplesect.para: true if 'signature' can be verified by 'ec_public_key'

detaileddescription.para: Generate a shared secret given Elliptical Curve Diffie-Hellman parameters This function internally uses 'openssl_hkdf' to extract and expand the output of the ECDH function using 'params' for options

parameterdescription.para: the parameters to use for the ECDH and HKDF algorithms

simplesect.para: a buffer containing the expanded shared secret or NULL if the key exchange cannot be computed

parameterdescription.para: the data to take the HMAC of
a key to use for HMAC
the digest mode to perform HMAC with. This will determine the length of the output

simplesect.para: a buffer containing the HMAC of 'data' with 'hmac_key'

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_buffer_t *data, const wickr_buffer_t *hmac_key, wickr_digest_t mode, const wickr_buffer_t *expected)
memberdef.name: openssl_hmac_verify

detaileddescription.para: Verify an HMAC against an expected result

parameterdescription.para: the data to calculate the expected HMAC with
the key to use along with 'data' to create the expected HMAC with
the mode to use for generating the expected HMAC
the value to compare the generated HMAC with

simplesect.para: true if 'expected' is equal to the HMAC of 'data' and 'hmac_key'

memberdef.argsstring: (const wickr_buffer_t *input_key_material, const wickr_buffer_t *salt, const wickr_buffer_t *info, wickr_digest_t hash_mode)
memberdef.name: openssl_hkdf

detaileddescription.para: Derive a key with HMAC Key Derivation Function

parameterdescription.para: the original key to extract and expand using HKDF
a salt value to provide to HKDF, this should be randomly generated or NULL if no salt should be used
contextual information to pass to HKDF, this can be NULL if no contextual information should be used
the hash mode to use for the HKDF output, this will determine the length of the final output

simplesect.para: a buffer containing the calculated HKDF value

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the SHA2 hash of a file

parameterdescription.para: a file to take the hash of it's contents
the mode to use for calculating the hash

simplesect.para: a buffer containing the output of the chosen SHA2 mode of the contents of in_file

parameterdescription.para: the file to encrypt
the key to use for AES256
a file that should contain the encrypted data

simplesect.para: true if encryption succeeds, and 'out_file' can be written

detaileddescription.para: Note: Unauthenticated modes will always succeed and the contents of 'out_file' may be incorrect For this reason it is useful to use an authenticated mode such as AES256 GCM when encrypting files

parameterdescription.para: the encrypted file to decrypt
the key to use for decryption
the file to write the decrypted data from 'in_file'
if true, only authenticated ciphers may be used for decryption

simplesect.para: true if the decryption operation succeeds, and 'out_file' can be written
